title: Unable to download Genomic segmentation problems
body:
When I run  `Rscript -e 'PeakSegPipeline::downloadProblems("hg38", "hg38_problems.bed")' `, I get the following error:

```
(peakerror) [athersh@biowulf PeakSegPipeline]$ Rscript -e 'PeakSegPipeline::downloadProblems("hg38", "hg38_problems.bed")'
trying URL 'http://hgdownload.soe.ucsc.edu/goldenPath/hg38/database/chromInfo.txt.gz'
Content type 'application/x-gzip' length 3804 bytes
==================================================
downloaded 3804 bytes

gunzip /tmp/RtmpFpRdQo/file60b26b2d758b.gz 
trying URL 'http://hgdownload.soe.ucsc.edu/goldenPath/hg38/database/gap.txt.gz'
Content type 'application/x-gzip' length 12165 bytes (11 KB)
==================================================
downloaded 11 KB

gunzip /tmp/RtmpFpRdQo/file60b26110032f.gz 
Error in fread(gap.bed) : 
  'input' must be a single character string containing a file name, a command, full path to a file, a URL starting 'http[s]://', 'ftp[s]://' or 'file://', or the input data itself
Calls: <Anonymous> -> gap2problems -> fread
Execution halted
```

title: Won't convert labels.txt to labels.bed
body:
I have a `labels.txt` file that looks like this 

```
chr2L:72,965-73,182 peakStart
chr2L:73,183-74,241 peaks
chr2L:74,242-74,305 peakEnd

chr2L:11,011,984-11,012,154 peakStart
chr2L:11,012,278-11,012,441 peakEnd
```

but when I run `Rscript -e 'PeakSegPipeline::convert_labels("labels.txt")'`, I get the error

```
Error in order(chrom, chromStart, chromEnd) : object 'chrom' not found
Calls: <Anonymous> -> order
Execution halted
```

Have I labeled the `labels.txt` file incorrectly?

title: Need to add repo before installing BerkeleyDB STL
body:
while running the following command 
`sudo aptitude install build-essential libdb6.0++-dev libdb6.0-stl-dev `
on a ubuntu16.04 system( I do have root access ), I faced the following error : 
```
build-essential is already installed at the requested version (12.1ubuntu2)
Couldn't find any package whose name or description matched "libdb6.0++-dev"
Couldn't find any package whose name or description matched "libdb6.0-stl-dev"
build-essential is already installed at the requested version (12.1ubuntu2)
Couldn't find any package whose name or description matched "libdb6.0++-dev"
Couldn't find any package whose name or description matched "libdb6.0-stl-dev"
```

I am guessing this is because we haven't added the appropriate repo before installing. Please provide the same or correct me in any other way

title: Edit in flag setting
body:
```
CPPFLAGS=-I${HOME}/include
LDFLAGS=-L${HOME}/lib -Wl,-rpath=${HOME}/lib
```
These commands should be written with quotes as : 

```
CPPFLAGS="-I${HOME}/include"
LDFLAGS="-L${HOME}/lib -Wl,-rpath=${HOME}/lib"
```
as the quotes should be compiled first and then fed into LDFLAGS

It would be great if some help can be rendered

title: invalid class “dgeMatrix” object: Not a valid 'Mnumeric' class object
body:
While running test-pipeline-demo.R 
I face the following error :```

```
Error in validObject(.Object) : 
  invalid class “dgeMatrix” object: Not a valid 'Mnumeric' class object
Calls: <Anonymous> ... Matrix -> new -> initialize -> initialize -> validObject
Execution halted
Error in system.or.stop(job.cmd) : non-zero exit code 1
```
Earlier I was facing the following error
```
Error in as.vector(data) : 
  no method for coercing this S4 class to a vector
```
Which I solved by installing package Matrix before running the Rscript.

Is there a similar hack for dgeMatrix error as well ?

title: Coverage files empty
body:
I am running the input-pipeline-test.
While trying to predict the peaks, R doesn't find any coverage files and thus its not predicting any peaks. Am i missing something in particular that might lead to this ?

```
bash /home/ubuntu/PeakSegPipeline-test/demo/problems/chr10:42746000-46426964/jointProblems.bed.sh 
head: cannot open '/home/ubuntu/PeakSegPipeline-test/demo/samples/bcell_/MS010302/problems/chr10:42746000-46426964/coverage.bedGraph' for reading: No such file or directory
bigWigToBedGraph -chrom=chr10 -start=42746000 -end=46426964 /home/ubuntu/PeakSegPipeline-test/demo/samples/bcell_/MS010302/coverage.bigWig /home/ubuntu/PeakSegPipeline-test/demo/samples/bcell_/MS010302/problems/chr10:42746000-46426964/coverage.bedGraph 
Error in fread(prob.cov.bedGraph) : 
  File is empty: /home/ubuntu/PeakSegPipeline-test/demo/samples/bcell_/MS010302/problems/chr10:42746000-46426964/coverage.bedGraph
Could not compute coverage in /home/ubuntu/PeakSegPipeline-test/demo/samples/bcell_/MS010302/problems/chr10:42746000-46426964 so not predicting peaks.
```

title: import rtracklayer / remove sys reqs ucsc command line
body:
would be nice to drop the system requirement of ucsc command line programs, and instead use a more portable R package. 

seems like https://github.com/lawremi/rtracklayer supports bigWig import/export but what about bigBed display of peak predictions and labels?

search https://github.com/lawremi/rtracklayer/search?q=bigBed&unscoped_q=bigBed shows some refs to bigBed in C code but no R code.

thread https://grokbase.com/t/r/bioconductor/12c293pab8/bioc-bigbed-support-in-rtracklayer seems to indicate that tabix should be used instead of bigBed, but that does not appear as one of the supported track hub formats on http://genome.cse.ucsc.edu/goldenPath/help/hgTrackHubHelp.html

title: sorting prior to bigWigToBedGraph
body:
```
th798@wind:~/genomic-ml/public_data/PeakSegFPOP/labels(penaltyLearning*)$ bash H3K4me3_TDH_immune/hub.sh
/projects/genomic-ml/public_data/PeakSegFPOP/labels/H3K4me3_TDH_immune/samples/bcell/McGill0091/joint_peaks.bed\
Graph is not case-sensitive sorted at line 15617.  Please use "sort -k1,1 -k2,2n" with LC_COLLATE=C,  or bedSor\
t and try again.
Error in system.or.stop(cmd) : non-zero exit code 255
Calls: <Anonymous> -> bedGraphToBigWig -> system.or.stop
Execution halted
th798@wind:~/genomic-ml/public_data/PeakSegFPOP/labels(penaltyLearning*)$
```
the line in question is
```
chr9    140979462       140981329       24.81
chr10   82168   87215   9.20
```
which means we have to sort alphabetically?

title: incomprehensible error message when contig dir is not in correct format
body:
Hi @brookesebranek thanks for the issue report via email which said:

These are the codes I tried to enter:

PeakSegPipeline::problem.target(problem.dir = "H3K4me3_TDH_ENCODE/samples/thyroid/ENCFF014AIG", verbose = getOption("PeakSegPipeline.verbose", 1))

PeakSegPipeline::problem.target("H3K4me3_TDH_ENCODE/samples/thyroid/ENCFF014AIG") 

PeakSegPipeline::problem.target(problem.dir = "chrom10_data", verbose = getOption("PeakSegPipeline.verbose", 1))
 
and the error I get for all of them is
```
Error in stop_for_na(make.na) :
  subject 1 did not match regex below; to output missing rows use nomatch.error=FALSE
(?:(chr[^-:]+)[-:]([0-9]+)-([0-9]+))
```

title: no error message when bigWigToBedGraph has one input and character vector multiple outputs
